## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm interested in launching a currency on Verus that has a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum. Can you walk me through how to do that?

**AI Assistant:**
To define a currency on Verus with a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum, you need a VerusID with the same name as the currency you want to create. The controller of this VerusID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and it can only be done once. You also need to have enough VRSC in the namespace VerusID to cover the launch cost. Additionally, you need to specify the Ethereum smart contract address of the ERC-20 you want to map to in the `address` field. Are you planning on launching a currency soon?

**User:**
Yeah, I think so. But before I do, I want to know what the costs are going to be. What's the cost of launching a currency on Verus with a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum?

**AI Assistant:**
The cost of launching a currency on Verus is 200 VRSC. Additionally, you need to have a VerusID of the same name as the currency, which costs 100 VRSC (or 80 VRSC when using a referral). Alternatively, you can use a.vETH subID, which costs an amount of Bridge.vETH (0.01 vETH worth). It's a one-time payment, and it's a relatively small cost considering the benefits of having a currency on Verus.

**User:**
That makes sense. I'm still a bit unclear on the role of VerusIDs in all this. What's the purpose of a VerusID in the context of launching a currency on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
A VerusID is required to launch a currency on Verus. The controller of the VerusID with the same name as the currency is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and it can only be done once. Think of the VerusID as a unique identifier that gives you control over the currency. It's a way to prove ownership and ensure that only the intended person can create and manage the currency. Does that make sense?
How do I define a currency on Verus with a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum?

To define a currency on Verus with a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum, you need a VerusID with the same name as the currency you want to create. The controller of this VerusID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and it can only be done once. You also need to have enough VRSC in the namespace VerusID to cover the launch cost. Additionally, you need to specify the Ethereum smart contract address of the ERC-20 you want to map to in the `address` field.

# Launch currency with 1:1 mapping of ERC-20When defining a currency it can be mapped to an ERC-20 1:1. The currency on Verus and the ERC-20 on Ethereum are then always interchangeable 1 to 1. [More on the Verus-Ethereum Bridge.](/eth-bridge/)::: tip ↔️ Verus-Ethereum Bridge 👨‍🔧 For Testnet!
[👉 Access the Verus-Ethereum Testnet Bridge](https://ethbridge.verustest.net/) (⚠️ Goerli testnet)
:::::: tip ↔️ Verus-Ethereum Bridge ✅ For Mainnet!
[👉 Access the Verus-Ethereum Mainnet Bridge](https://eth.verusbridge.io)
:::::: warning Need help setting up a currency launch? 🤔
[👉 Go to the Verus Discord #pbaas-development channel. The community is happy to assist!](https://www.verus.io/discord)
:::### Defining the currency
To create a currency of a specific name, we need a VerusID of the same name. The controller of this VerusID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and we can only do so once.The cost for a VerusID on the Verus is ``100 VRSC`` (or 80 when using a referral). The cost to launch a currency is ``200 VRSC``. Before launching we need to have enough VRSC in the namespace VerusID.You can also use a .vETH subID. The cost to register a .vETH subID is an amount of Bridge.vETH (0.01 vETH worth).In our example we have a namespace ``MyUSDC`` with which we want to launch a currency that is mapped to the Ethereum ``USDC`` ERC-20 (on Goerli testnet, [see contract address](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x98339D8C260052B7ad81c28c16C0b98420f2B46a)).Below is the command to map a currency 1:1 to an ERC-20 on Ethereum. The ``address`` field is the Ethereum smart contract address of the ERC-20 we want to map to.
What is the cost of launching a currency on Verus with a 1:1 mapping to an ERC-20 on Ethereum?

The cost of launching a currency on Verus is 200 VRSC. Additionally, you need to have a VerusID of the same name as the currency, which costs 100 VRSC (or 80 VRSC when using a referral). Alternatively, you can use a.vETH subID, which costs an amount of Bridge.vETH (0.01 vETH worth).
